lead_paragraph: The storm’s devastation reflects the very nature of the many challenges faced by Haiti, where infrastructure had already been in decline for decades.

byline.contributor: Jeremy Dupin contributed reporting from Port-au-Prince, Haiti.

headline.print_headline: As Waters Ebb, Haiti Staggers Under the Toll
headline.main: Hurricane Matthew Makes Old Problems Worse for Haitians

snippet: The storm’s devastation reflects the very nature of the many challenges faced by Haiti, where infrastructure had already been in decline for decades....
abstract: Hurricane Matthew devastates Haiti, with initial death toll estimates as high as 842 people in country's worst natural disaster since 2010 earthquake; Haitian government, struggling with long-term deficiencies in country's infrastructure and communications systems, is ill equipped to deal with level of damage and is relying on United Nations to help coordinate distribution of aid from international humanitarian groups.
